response.content:
{
  "step1": "Gather all ingredients: 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 cups granulated sugar, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup buttermilk, 1 cup warm water, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 large eggs, and 1 cup boiling water. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Allow pans to warm slightly before greasing. Now",
  "step2": "In a large bowl, whisk flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until combined. Make a well, then add buttermilk, warm water, oil, eggs, and vanilla. Stir gently with a spatula until batter is smooth, glossy, and free of dry patches. It should be thick yet pourable.",
  "step3": "Gradually whisk the boiling water into the batter, causing it to thin slightly; this enhances chocolate flavor and moisture. Simultaneously, grease two 9‑inch round cake pans with butter, then dust with flour, tapping out excess. Divide batter evenly between pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. No bubbles remain before baking.",
  "step4": "Place pans on the middle rack of the preheated oven. Bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean with only moist crumbs. Rotate pans halfway through baking for even heat distribution, then remove from oven and set aside to cool. Let them cool briefly.",
  "step5": "While cakes cool, prepare chocolate ganache frosting. Heat 1 cup heavy cream in a saucepan until just simmering, then pour over 8 ounces chopped dark chocolate in a heat‑proof bowl. Let sit one minute, then whisk until glossy and smooth. Add a pinch of salt for depth. Cool slightly before spreading cakes.",
  "step6": "Level each cake layer with a serrated knife, then place the first layer on a serving plate. Spread a generous layer of ganache over the top, then position the second layer. Frost the top and sides evenly, smoothing with an offset spatula. Refrigerate 20 minutes, slice, and enjoy. Serve immediately."
}
